DataElement.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary perihilar bile duct carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intrahepatic Large Bile Duct Neoplasm Pathologic T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The larger bile ducts which are located within the liver and drain bile from the smaller peripheral intrahepatic bile ducts into the right and left hepatic ducts._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The larger bile ducts which are located within the liver and drain bile from the smaller peripheral intrahepatic bile ducts into the right and left hepatic ducts.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: The larger bile ducts which are located within the liver and drain bile from the smaller peripheral intrahepatic bile ducts into the right and left hepatic ducts.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8-30-19 tmt released.; 12/12/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of perihilar bile duct cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to perihilar cholangiocarcinomas. Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors and sarcomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading the main portal vein or its branches bilaterally, or the common hepatic artery; or unilateral second-order biliary radicals with contralateral portal vein or hepatic artery involvement. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading the main portal vein or its branches bilaterally, or the common hepatic artery; or unilateral second-order biliary radicals with contralateral portal vein or hepatic artery involvement. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading unilateral branches of the portal vein or hepatic artery. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading unilateral branches of the portal vein or hepatic artery. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading adjacent hepatic parenchyma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading adjacent hepatic parenchyma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading beyond the wall of the bile duct to surrounding adipose tissue. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading beyond the wall of the bile duct to surrounding adipose tissue. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading beyond the wall of the bile duct to surrounding adipose tissue, or tumor invading adjacent hepatic parenchyma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor invading beyond the wall of the bile duct to surrounding adipose tissue, or tumor invading adjacent hepatic parenchyma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor confined to the bile duct, with extension up to the muscle layer or fibrous tissue. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with tumor confined to the bile duct, with extension up to the muscle layer or fibrous tissue. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ/high grade dysplasia. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ/high grade dysplasia. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Perihilar bile duct cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Perihilar Bile Duct Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Perihilar bile duct cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
